00001 /* ========================================================================================== */
00002 /* FMOD Ex - DSP header file. Copyright (c), Firelight Technologies Pty, Ltd. 2004-2011.      */
00003 /*                                                                                            */
00004 /* Use this header if you are interested in delving deeper into the FMOD software mixing /    */
00005 /* DSP engine.  In this header you can find parameter structures for FMOD system reigstered   */
00006 /* DSP effects and generators.                                                                */
00007 /* Also use this header if you are wanting to develop your own DSP plugin to use with FMOD's  */
00008 /* dsp system.  With this header you can make your own DSP plugin that FMOD can               */
00009 /* register and use.  See the documentation and examples on how to make a working plugin.     */
00010 /*                                                                                            */
00011 /* ========================================================================================== */
00012 
00013 #ifndef _FMOD_DSP_H
00014 #define _FMOD_DSP_H

00016 typedef struct FMOD_DSP_STATE FMOD_DSP_STATE;

00018 /* 
00019     DSP callbacks
00020 */
00021 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_DSP_CREATECALLBACK)     (FMOD_DSP_STATE *dsp_state);
00022 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_DSP_RELEASECALLBACK)    (FMOD_DSP_STATE *dsp_state);
00023 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_DSP_RESETCALLBACK)      (FMOD_DSP_STATE *dsp_state);
00024 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_DSP_READCALLBACK)       (FMOD_DSP_STATE *dsp_state, float *inbuffer, float *outbuffer, unsigned int length, int inchannels, int outchannels);
00025 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_DSP_SETPOSITIONCALLBACK)(FMOD_DSP_STATE *dsp_state, unsigned int pos);
00026 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_DSP_SETPARAMCALLBACK)   (FMOD_DSP_STATE *dsp_state, int index, float value);
00027 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_DSP_GETPARAMCALLBACK)   (FMOD_DSP_STATE *dsp_state, int index, float *value, char *valuestr);
00028 typedef FMOD_RESULT (F_CALLBACK *FMOD_DSP_DIALOGCALLBACK)     (FMOD_DSP_STATE *dsp_state, void *hwnd, int show);
00029 
00030 /*
00031 [ENUM]
00032 [
00033     [DESCRIPTION]   
00034     These definitions can be used for creating FMOD defined special effects or DSP units.
00035 
00036     [REMARKS]
00037     To get them to be active, first create the unit, then add it somewhere into the DSP network, either at the front of the network near the soundcard unit to affect the global output (by using System::getDSPHead), or on a single channel (using Channel::getDSPHead).
00038 
00039     [PLATFORMS]
00040     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00041 
00042     [SEE_ALSO]
00043     System::createDSPByType
00044 ]
00045 */
00046 typedef enum
00047 {
00048     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_UNKNOWN,            /* This unit was created via a non FMOD plugin so has an unknown purpose. */
00049     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_MIXER,              /* This unit does nothing but take inputs and mix them together then feed the result to the soundcard unit. */
00050     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_OSCILLATOR,         /* This unit generates sine/square/saw/triangle or noise tones. */
00051     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_LOWPASS,            /* This unit filters sound using a high quality, resonant lowpass filter algorithm but consumes more CPU time. */
00052     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_ITLOWPASS,          /* This unit filters sound using a resonant lowpass filter algorithm that is used in Impulse Tracker, but with limited cutoff range (0 to 8060hz). */
00053     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_HIGHPASS,           /* This unit filters sound using a resonant highpass filter algorithm. */
00054     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_ECHO,               /* This unit produces an echo on the sound and fades out at the desired rate. */
00055     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_FLANGE,             /* This unit produces a flange effect on the sound. */
00056     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_DISTORTION,         /* This unit distorts the sound. */
00057     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_NORMALIZE,          /* This unit normalizes or amplifies the sound to a certain level. */
00058     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_PARAMEQ,            /* This unit attenuates or amplifies a selected frequency range. */
00059     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_PITCHSHIFT,         /* This unit bends the pitch of a sound without changing the speed of playback. */
00060     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_CHORUS,             /* This unit produces a chorus effect on the sound. */
00061     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_VSTPLUGIN,          /* This unit allows the use of Steinberg VST plugins */
00062     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_WINAMPPLUGIN,       /* This unit allows the use of Nullsoft Winamp plugins */
00063     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_ITECHO,             /* This unit produces an echo on the sound and fades out at the desired rate as is used in Impulse Tracker. */
00064     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_COMPRESSOR,         /* This unit implements dynamic compression (linked multichannel, wideband) */
00065     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_SFXREVERB,          /* This unit implements SFX reverb */
00066     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_LOWPASS_SIMPLE,     /* This unit filters sound using a simple lowpass with no resonance, but has flexible cutoff and is fast. */
00067     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_DELAY,              /* This unit produces different delays on individual channels of the sound. */
00068     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_TREMOLO,            /* This unit produces a tremolo / chopper effect on the sound. */
00069     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_LADSPAPLUGIN,       /* This unit allows the use of LADSPA standard plugins. */
00070     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_HIGHPASS_SIMPLE,    /* This unit filters sound using a simple highpass with no resonance, but has flexible cutoff and is fast. */
00071     FMOD_DSP_TYPE_FORCEINT = 65536    /* Makes sure this enum is signed 32bit. */
00072 } FMOD_DSP_TYPE;
00073 
00074 
00075 /*
00076 [STRUCTURE] 
00077 [
00078     [DESCRIPTION]
00079     Structure to define a parameter for a DSP unit.
00080 
00081     [REMARKS]
00082     Members marked with [r] mean the variable is modified by FMOD and is for reading purposes only.  Do not change this value.<br>
00083     Members marked with [w] mean the variable can be written to.  The user can set the value.<br>
00084     <br>
00085     The step parameter tells the gui or application that the parameter has a certain granularity.<br>
00086     For example in the example of cutoff frequency with a range from 100.0 to 22050.0 you might only want the selection to be in 10hz increments.  For this you would simply use 10.0 as the step value.<br>
00087     For a boolean, you can use min = 0.0, max = 1.0, step = 1.0.  This way the only possible values are 0.0 and 1.0.<br>
00088     Some applications may detect min = 0.0, max = 1.0, step = 1.0 and replace a graphical slider bar with a checkbox instead.<br>
00089     A step value of 1.0 would simulate integer values only.<br>
00090     A step value of 0.0 would mean the full floating point range is accessable.<br>
00091 
00092     [PLATFORMS]
00093     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00094 
00095     [SEE_ALSO]    
00096     System::createDSP
00097     DSP::setParameter
00098 ]
00099 */
00100 typedef struct FMOD_DSP_PARAMETERDESC
00101 {
00102     float       min;                                /* [w] Minimum value of the parameter (ie 100.0). */
00103     float       max;                                /* [w] Maximum value of the parameter (ie 22050.0). */
00104     float       defaultval;                         /* [w] Default value of parameter. */
00105     char        name[16];                           /* [w] Name of the parameter to be displayed (ie "Cutoff frequency"). */
00106     char        label[16];                          /* [w] Short string to be put next to value to denote the unit type (ie "hz"). */
00107     const char *description;                        /* [w] Description of the parameter to be displayed as a help item / tooltip for this parameter. */
00108 } FMOD_DSP_PARAMETERDESC;
00109 
00110 
00111 /*
00112 [STRUCTURE] 
00113 [
00114     [DESCRIPTION]
00115     When creating a DSP unit, declare one of these and provide the relevant callbacks and name for FMOD to use when it creates and uses a DSP unit of this type.
00116 
00117     [REMARKS]
00118     Members marked with [r] mean the variable is modified by FMOD and is for reading purposes only.  Do not change this value.<br>
00119     Members marked with [w] mean the variable can be written to.  The user can set the value.<br>
00120     <br>
00121     There are 2 different ways to change a parameter in this architecture.<br>
00122     One is to use DSP::setParameter / DSP::getParameter.  This is platform independant and is dynamic, so new unknown plugins can have their parameters enumerated and used.<br>
00123     The other is to use DSP::showConfigDialog.  This is platform specific and requires a GUI, and will display a dialog box to configure the plugin.<br>
00124 
00125     [PLATFORMS]
00126     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00127 
00128     [SEE_ALSO]    
00129     System::createDSP
00130     FMOD_DSP_STATE
00131 ]
00132 */
00133 typedef struct FMOD_DSP_DESCRIPTION
00134 {
00135     char                         name[32];           /* [w] Name of the unit to be displayed in the network. */
00136     unsigned int                 version;            /* [w] Plugin writer's version number. */
00137     int                          channels;           /* [w] Number of channels.  Use 0 to process whatever number of channels is currently in the network.  >0 would be mostly used if the unit is a unit that only generates sound. */
00138     FMOD_DSP_CREATECALLBACK      create;             /* [w] Create callback.  This is called when DSP unit is created.  Can be null. */
00139     FMOD_DSP_RELEASECALLBACK     release;            /* [w] Release callback.  This is called just before the unit is freed so the user can do any cleanup needed for the unit.  Can be null. */
00140     FMOD_DSP_RESETCALLBACK       reset;              /* [w] Reset callback.  This is called by the user to reset any history buffers that may need resetting for a filter, when it is to be used or re-used for the first time to its initial clean state.  Use to avoid clicks or artifacts. */
00141     FMOD_DSP_READCALLBACK        read;               /* [w] Read callback.  Processing is done here.  Can be null. */
00142     FMOD_DSP_SETPOSITIONCALLBACK setposition;        /* [w] Set position callback.  This is called if the unit wants to update its position info but not process data, or reset a cursor position internally if it is reading data from a certain source.  Can be null. */
00143 
00144     int                          numparameters;      /* [w] Number of parameters used in this filter.  The user finds this with DSP::getNumParameters */
00145     FMOD_DSP_PARAMETERDESC      *paramdesc;          /* [w] Variable number of parameter structures. */
00146     FMOD_DSP_SETPARAMCALLBACK    setparameter;       /* [w] This is called when the user calls DSP::setParameter.  Can be null. */
00147     FMOD_DSP_GETPARAMCALLBACK    getparameter;       /* [w] This is called when the user calls DSP::getParameter.  Can be null. */
00148     FMOD_DSP_DIALOGCALLBACK      config;             /* [w] This is called when the user calls DSP::showConfigDialog.  Can be used to display a dialog to configure the filter.  Can be null. */
00149     int                          configwidth;        /* [w] Width of config dialog graphic if there is one.  0 otherwise.*/
00150     int                          configheight;       /* [w] Height of config dialog graphic if there is one.  0 otherwise.*/
00151     void                        *userdata;           /* [w] Optional. Specify 0 to ignore. This is user data to be attached to the DSP unit during creation.  Access via DSP::getUserData. */
00152 } FMOD_DSP_DESCRIPTION;
00153 
00154 
00155 /*
00156 [STRUCTURE] 
00157 [
00158     [DESCRIPTION]
00159     DSP plugin structure that is passed into each callback.
00160 
00161     [REMARKS]
00162     Members marked with [r] mean the variable is modified by FMOD and is for reading purposes only.  Do not change this value.<br>
00163     Members marked with [w] mean the variable can be written to.  The user can set the value.<br>
00164 
00165     [PLATFORMS]
00166     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00167 
00168     [SEE_ALSO]
00169     FMOD_DSP_DESCRIPTION
00170 ]
00171 */
00172 struct FMOD_DSP_STATE
00173 {
00174     FMOD_DSP      *instance;      /* [r] Handle to the DSP hand the user created.  Not to be modified.  C++ users cast to FMOD::DSP to use.  */
00175     void          *plugindata;    /* [w] Plugin writer created data the output author wants to attach to this object. */
00176     unsigned short speakermask;   /* [w] Specifies which speakers the DSP effect is active on */
00177 };
00178

00190 [ENUM]
00191 [  
00192     [DESCRIPTION]   
00193     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_OSCILLATOR filter.
00194

00196 
00197     [PLATFORMS]
00198     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00199

00201     DSP::setParameter
00202     DSP::getParameter
00203     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00204 ]
00205 */
00206 typedef enum
00207 {
00208     FMOD_DSP_OSCILLATOR_TYPE,   /* Waveform type.  0 = sine.  1 = square. 2 = sawup. 3 = sawdown. 4 = triangle. 5 = noise.  */
00209     FMOD_DSP_OSCILLATOR_RATE    /* Frequency of the sinewave in hz.  1.0 to 22000.0.  Default = 220.0. */
00210 } FMOD_DSP_OSCILLATOR;

00213 /*
00214 [ENUM]
00215 [  
00216     [DESCRIPTION]   
00217     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_LOWPASS filter.
00218 
00219     [REMARKS]
00220 
00221     [PLATFORMS]
00222     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00223 
00224     [SEE_ALSO]      
00225     DSP::setParameter
00226     DSP::getParameter
00227     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00228 ]
00229 */
00230 typedef enum
00231 {
00232     FMOD_DSP_LOWPASS_CUTOFF,    /* Lowpass cutoff frequency in hz.   10.0 to 22000.0.  Default = 5000.0. */
00233     FMOD_DSP_LOWPASS_RESONANCE  /* Lowpass resonance Q value. 1.0 to 10.0.  Default = 1.0. */
00234 } FMOD_DSP_LOWPASS;

00237 /*
00238 [ENUM]
00239 [  
00240     [DESCRIPTION]   
00241     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_ITLOWPASS filter.<br>
00242     This is different to the default FMOD_DSP_TYPE_ITLOWPASS filter in that it uses a different quality algorithm and is 
00243     the filter used to produce the correct sounding playback in .IT files.<br> 
00244     FMOD Ex's .IT playback uses this filter.<br>
00245 
00246     [REMARKS]
00247     Note! This filter actually has a limited cutoff frequency below the specified maximum, due to its limited design, 
00248     so for a more  open range filter use FMOD_DSP_LOWPASS or if you don't mind not having resonance, 
00249     FMOD_DSP_LOWPASS_SIMPLE.<br>
00250     The effective maximum cutoff is about 8060hz.
00251 
00252     [PLATFORMS]
00253     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00254 
00255     [SEE_ALSO]      
00256     DSP::setParameter
00257     DSP::getParameter
00258     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00259 ]
00260 */
00261 typedef enum
00262 {
00263     FMOD_DSP_ITLOWPASS_CUTOFF,    /* Lowpass cutoff frequency in hz.  1.0 to 22000.0.  Default = 5000.0/ */
00264     FMOD_DSP_ITLOWPASS_RESONANCE  /* Lowpass resonance Q value.  0.0 to 127.0.  Default = 1.0. */
00265 } FMOD_DSP_ITLOWPASS;
00266 
00267 
00268 /*
00269 [ENUM]
00270 [  
00271     [DESCRIPTION]   
00272     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_HIGHPASS filter.
00273 
00274     [REMARKS]
00275 
00276     [PLATFORMS]
00277     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00278 
00279     [SEE_ALSO]      
00280     DSP::setParameter
00281     DSP::getParameter
00282     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00283 ]
00284 */
00285 typedef enum
00286 {
00287     FMOD_DSP_HIGHPASS_CUTOFF,    /* Highpass cutoff frequency in hz.  1.0 to output 22000.0.  Default = 5000.0. */
00288     FMOD_DSP_HIGHPASS_RESONANCE  /* Highpass resonance Q value.  1.0 to 10.0.  Default = 1.0. */
00289 } FMOD_DSP_HIGHPASS;
00290 
00291 
00292 /*
00293 [ENUM]
00294 [  
00295     [DESCRIPTION]   
00296     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_ECHO filter.
00297 
00298     [REMARKS]
00299     Note.  Every time the delay is changed, the plugin re-allocates the echo buffer.  This means the echo will dissapear at that time while it refills its new buffer.<br>
00300     Larger echo delays result in larger amounts of memory allocated.<br>
00301     <br>
00302     '<i>maxchannels</i>' also dictates the amount of memory allocated.  By default, the maxchannels value is 0.  If FMOD is set to stereo, the echo unit will allocate enough memory for 2 channels.  If it is 5.1, it will allocate enough memory for a 6 channel echo, etc.<br>
00303     If the echo effect is only ever applied to the global mix (ie it was added with System::addDSP), then 0 is the value to set as it will be enough to handle all speaker modes.<br>
00304     When the echo is added to a channel (ie Channel::addDSP) then the channel count that comes in could be anything from 1 to 8 possibly.  It is only in this case where you might want to increase the channel count above the output's channel count.<br>
00305     If a channel echo is set to a lower number than the sound's channel count that is coming in, it will not echo the sound.<br>
00306 
00307     [PLATFORMS]
00308     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00309 
00310     [SEE_ALSO]      
00311     DSP::setParameter
00312     DSP::getParameter
00313     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00314 ]
00315 */
00316 typedef enum
00317 {
00318     FMOD_DSP_ECHO_DELAY,       /* Echo delay in ms.  10  to 5000.  Default = 500. */
00319     FMOD_DSP_ECHO_DECAYRATIO,  /* Echo decay per delay.  0 to 1.  1.0 = No decay, 0.0 = total decay (ie simple 1 line delay).  Default = 0.5. */
00320     FMOD_DSP_ECHO_MAXCHANNELS, /* Maximum channels supported.  0 to 16.  0 = same as fmod's default output polyphony, 1 = mono, 2 = stereo etc.  See remarks for more.  Default = 0.  It is suggested to leave at 0! */
00321     FMOD_DSP_ECHO_DRYMIX,      /* Volume of original signal to pass to output.  0.0 to 1.0. Default = 1.0. */
00322     FMOD_DSP_ECHO_WETMIX       /* Volume of echo signal to pass to output.  0.0 to 1.0. Default = 1.0. */
00323 } FMOD_DSP_ECHO;
00324 
00325 
00326 /*
00327 [ENUM]
00328 [  
00329     [DESCRIPTION]   
00330     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_DELAY filter.
00331 
00332     [REMARKS]
00333     Note.  Every time MaxDelay is changed, the plugin re-allocates the delay buffer.  This means the delay will dissapear at that time while it refills its new buffer.<br>
00334     A larger MaxDelay results in larger amounts of memory allocated.<br>
00335     Channel delays above MaxDelay will be clipped to MaxDelay and the delay buffer will not be resized.<br>
00336     <br>
00337 
00338     [PLATFORMS]
00339     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00340 
00341     [SEE_ALSO]      
00342     DSP::setParameter
00343     DSP::getParameter
00344     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00345 ]
00346 */
00347 typedef enum
00348 {
00349     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH0,      /* Channel #0 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00350     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH1,      /* Channel #1 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00351     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH2,      /* Channel #2 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00352     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH3,      /* Channel #3 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00353     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH4,      /* Channel #4 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00354     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH5,      /* Channel #5 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00355     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH6,      /* Channel #6 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00356     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH7,      /* Channel #7 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00357     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH8,      /* Channel #8 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00358     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH9,      /* Channel #9 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00359     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH10,     /* Channel #10 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00360     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH11,     /* Channel #11 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00361     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH12,     /* Channel #12 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00362     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH13,     /* Channel #13 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00363     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH14,     /* Channel #14 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00364     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_CH15,     /* Channel #15 Delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 0. */
00365     FMOD_DSP_DELAY_MAXDELAY  /* Maximum delay in ms.  0  to 10000.  Default = 10. */
00366 } FMOD_DSP_DELAY;
00367 
00368 
00369 /*
00370 [ENUM]
00371 [  
00372     [DESCRIPTION]   
00373     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_FLANGE filter.
00374 
00375     [REMARKS]
00376     Flange is an effect where the signal is played twice at the same time, and one copy slides back and forth creating a whooshing or flanging effect.<br>
00377     As there are 2 copies of the same signal, by default each signal is given 50% mix, so that the total is not louder than the original unaffected signal.<br>
00378     <br>
00379     Flange depth is a percentage of a 10ms shift from the original signal.  Anything above 10ms is not considered flange because to the ear it begins to 'echo' so 10ms is the highest value possible.<br>
00380 
00381     [PLATFORMS]
00382     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00383 
00384     [SEE_ALSO]      
00385     DSP::setParameter
00386     DSP::getParameter
00387     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00388 ]
00389 */
00390 typedef enum
00391 {
00392     FMOD_DSP_FLANGE_DRYMIX,      /* Volume of original signal to pass to output.  0.0 to 1.0. Default = 0.45. */
00393     FMOD_DSP_FLANGE_WETMIX,      /* Volume of flange signal to pass to output.  0.0 to 1.0. Default = 0.55. */
00394     FMOD_DSP_FLANGE_DEPTH,       /* Flange depth.  0.01 to 1.0.  Default = 1.0. */
00395     FMOD_DSP_FLANGE_RATE         /* Flange speed in hz.  0.0 to 20.0.  Default = 0.1. */
00396 } FMOD_DSP_FLANGE;
00397 
00398 
00399 /*
00400 [ENUM]
00401 [  
00402     [DESCRIPTION]   
00403     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_TREMOLO filter.
00404 
00405     [REMARKS]
00406     The tremolo effect varies the amplitude of a sound. Depending on the settings, this unit can produce a tremolo, chopper or auto-pan effect.<br>
00407     <br>
00408     The shape of the LFO (low freq. oscillator) can morphed between sine, triangle and sawtooth waves using the FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_SHAPE and FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_SKEW parameters.<br>
00409     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_DUTY and FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_SQUARE are useful for a chopper-type effect where the first controls the on-time duration and second controls the flatness of the envelope.<br>
00410     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_SPREAD varies the LFO phase between channels to get an auto-pan effect. This works best with a sine shape LFO.<br>
00411     The LFO can be synchronized using the FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_PHASE parameter which sets its instantaneous phase.<br>
00412 
00413     [PLATFORMS]
00414     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00415 
00416     [SEE_ALSO]      
00417     DSP::setParameter
00418     DSP::getParameter
00419     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00420 ]
00421 */
00422 typedef enum
00423 {
00424     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_FREQUENCY,     /* LFO frequency in Hz.  0.1 to 20.  Default = 4. */
00425     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_DEPTH,         /* Tremolo depth.  0 to 1.  Default = 0. */
00426     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_SHAPE,         /* LFO shape morph between triangle and sine.  0 to 1.  Default = 0. */
00427     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_SKEW,          /* Time-skewing of LFO cycle.  -1 to 1.  Default = 0. */
00428     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_DUTY,          /* LFO on-time.  0 to 1.  Default = 0.5. */
00429     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_SQUARE,        /* Flatness of the LFO shape.  0 to 1.  Default = 0. */
00430     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_PHASE,         /* Instantaneous LFO phase.  0 to 1.  Default = 0. */
00431     FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO_SPREAD         /* Rotation / auto-pan effect.  -1 to 1.  Default = 0. */
00432 } FMOD_DSP_TREMOLO;

00458 /*
00459 [ENUM]
00460 [  
00461     [DESCRIPTION]   
00462     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_NORMALIZE filter.
00463 
00464     [REMARKS]
00465     Normalize amplifies the sound based on the maximum peaks within the signal.<br>
00466     For example if the maximum peaks in the signal were 50% of the bandwidth, it would scale the whole sound by 2.<br>
00467     The lower threshold value makes the normalizer ignores peaks below a certain point, to avoid over-amplification if a loud signal suddenly came in, and also to avoid amplifying to maximum things like background hiss.<br>
00468     <br>
00469     Because FMOD is a realtime audio processor, it doesn't have the luxury of knowing the peak for the whole sound (ie it can't see into the future), so it has to process data as it comes in.<br>
00470     To avoid very sudden changes in volume level based on small samples of new data, fmod fades towards the desired amplification which makes for smooth gain control.  The fadetime parameter can control this.<br>
00471 
00472     [PLATFORMS]
00473     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00474 
00475     [SEE_ALSO]      
00476     DSP::setParameter
00477     DSP::getParameter
00478     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00479 ]
00480 */
00481 typedef enum
00482 {
00483     FMOD_DSP_NORMALIZE_FADETIME,    /* Time to ramp the silence to full in ms.  0.0 to 20000.0. Default = 5000.0. */
00484     FMOD_DSP_NORMALIZE_THRESHHOLD,  /* Lower volume range threshold to ignore.  0.0 to 1.0.  Default = 0.1.  Raise higher to stop amplification of very quiet signals. */
00485     FMOD_DSP_NORMALIZE_MAXAMP       /* Maximum amplification allowed.  1.0 to 100000.0.  Default = 20.0.  1.0 = no amplifaction, higher values allow more boost. */
00486 } FMOD_DSP_NORMALIZE;
00487 
00488 
00489 /*
00490 [ENUM]
00491 [  
00492     [DESCRIPTION]   
00493     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_PARAMEQ filter.
00494 
00495     [REMARKS]
00496     Parametric EQ is a bandpass filter that attenuates or amplifies a selected frequency and its neighbouring frequencies.<br>
00497     <br>
00498     To create a multi-band EQ create multiple FMOD_DSP_TYPE_PARAMEQ units and set each unit to different frequencies, for example 1000hz, 2000hz, 4000hz, 8000hz, 16000hz with a range of 1 octave each.<br>
00499     <br>
00500     When a frequency has its gain set to 1.0, the sound will be unaffected and represents the original signal exactly.<br>
00501 
00502     [PLATFORMS]
00503     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00504 
00505     [SEE_ALSO]      
00506     DSP::setParameter
00507     DSP::getParameter
00508     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00509 ]
00510 */
00511 typedef enum
00512 {
00513     FMOD_DSP_PARAMEQ_CENTER,     /* Frequency center.  20.0 to 22000.0.  Default = 8000.0. */
00514     FMOD_DSP_PARAMEQ_BANDWIDTH,  /* Octave range around the center frequency to filter.  0.2 to 5.0.  Default = 1.0. */
00515     FMOD_DSP_PARAMEQ_GAIN        /* Frequency Gain.  0.05 to 3.0.  Default = 1.0.  */
00516 } FMOD_DSP_PARAMEQ;
00517 
00518 
00519 
00520 /*
00521 [ENUM]
00522 [  
00523     [DESCRIPTION]   
00524     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_PITCHSHIFT filter.
00525 
00526     [REMARKS]
00527     This pitch shifting unit can be used to change the pitch of a sound without speeding it up or slowing it down.<br>
00528     It can also be used for time stretching or scaling, for example if the pitch was doubled, and the frequency of the sound was halved, the pitch of the sound would sound correct but it would be twice as slow.<br>
00529     <br>
00530     <b>Warning!</b> This filter is very computationally expensive!  Similar to a vocoder, it requires several overlapping FFT and IFFT's to produce smooth output, and can require around 440mhz for 1 stereo 48khz signal using the default settings.<br>
00531     Reducing the signal to mono will half the cpu usage.<br>
00532     Reducing this will lower audio quality, but what settings to use are largely dependant on the sound being played.  A noisy polyphonic signal will need higher fft size compared to a speaking voice for example.<br>
00533     <br>
00534     This pitch shifter is based on the pitch shifter code at http://www.dspdimension.com, written by Stephan M. Bernsee.<br>
00535     The original code is COPYRIGHT 1999-2003 Stephan M. Bernsee <smb@dspdimension.com>.<br>
00536     <br>
00537     '<i>maxchannels</i>' dictates the amount of memory allocated.  By default, the maxchannels value is 0.  If FMOD is set to stereo, the pitch shift unit will allocate enough memory for 2 channels.  If it is 5.1, it will allocate enough memory for a 6 channel pitch shift, etc.<br>
00538     If the pitch shift effect is only ever applied to the global mix (ie it was added with System::addDSP), then 0 is the value to set as it will be enough to handle all speaker modes.<br>
00539     When the pitch shift is added to a channel (ie Channel::addDSP) then the channel count that comes in could be anything from 1 to 8 possibly.  It is only in this case where you might want to increase the channel count above the output's channel count.<br>
00540     If a channel pitch shift is set to a lower number than the sound's channel count that is coming in, it will not pitch shift the sound.<br>
00541 
00542     [PLATFORMS]
00543     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00544 
00545     [SEE_ALSO]      
00546     DSP::setParameter
00547     DSP::getParameter
00548     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00549 ]
00550 */
00551 typedef enum
00552 {
00553     FMOD_DSP_PITCHSHIFT_PITCH,       /* Pitch value.  0.5 to 2.0.  Default = 1.0. 0.5 = one octave down, 2.0 = one octave up.  1.0 does not change the pitch. */
00554     FMOD_DSP_PITCHSHIFT_FFTSIZE,     /* FFT window size.  256, 512, 1024, 2048, 4096.  Default = 1024.  Increase this to reduce 'smearing'.  This effect is a warbling sound similar to when an mp3 is encoded at very low bitrates. */
00555     FMOD_DSP_PITCHSHIFT_OVERLAP,     /* Removed.  Do not use.  FMOD now uses 4 overlaps and cannot be changed. */
00556     FMOD_DSP_PITCHSHIFT_MAXCHANNELS  /* Maximum channels supported.  0 to 16.  0 = same as fmod's default output polyphony, 1 = mono, 2 = stereo etc.  See remarks for more.  Default = 0.  It is suggested to leave at 0! */
00557 } FMOD_DSP_PITCHSHIFT;
00558 
00559 
00560 
00561 /*
00562 [ENUM]
00563 [  
00564     [DESCRIPTION]   
00565     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_CHORUS filter.
00566 
00567     [REMARKS]
00568     Chrous is an effect where the sound is more 'spacious' due to 1 to 3 versions of the sound being played along side the original signal but with the pitch of each copy modulating on a sine wave.<br>
00569     This is a highly configurable chorus unit.  It supports 3 taps, small and large delay times and also feedback.<br>
00570     This unit also could be used to do a simple echo, or a flange effect. 
00571 
00572     [PLATFORMS]
00573     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00574 
00575     [SEE_ALSO]      
00576     DSP::setParameter
00577     DSP::getParameter
00578     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00579 ]
00580 */
00581 typedef enum
00582 {
00583     FMOD_DSP_CHORUS_DRYMIX,   /* Volume of original signal to pass to output.  0.0 to 1.0. Default = 0.5. */
00584     FMOD_DSP_CHORUS_WETMIX1,  /* Volume of 1st chorus tap.  0.0 to 1.0.  Default = 0.5. */
00585     FMOD_DSP_CHORUS_WETMIX2,  /* Volume of 2nd chorus tap. This tap is 90 degrees out of phase of the first tap.  0.0 to 1.0.  Default = 0.5. */
00586     FMOD_DSP_CHORUS_WETMIX3,  /* Volume of 3rd chorus tap. This tap is 90 degrees out of phase of the second tap.  0.0 to 1.0.  Default = 0.5. */
00587     FMOD_DSP_CHORUS_DELAY,    /* Chorus delay in ms.  0.1 to 100.0.  Default = 40.0 ms. */
00588     FMOD_DSP_CHORUS_RATE,     /* Chorus modulation rate in hz.  0.0 to 20.0.  Default = 0.8 hz. */
00589     FMOD_DSP_CHORUS_DEPTH,    /* Chorus modulation depth.  0.0 to 1.0.  Default = 0.03. */
00590     FMOD_DSP_CHORUS_FEEDBACK  /* Chorus feedback.  Controls how much of the wet signal gets fed back into the chorus buffer.  0.0 to 1.0.  Default = 0.0. */
00591 } FMOD_DSP_CHORUS;

00594 /*
00595 [ENUM]
00596 [  
00597     [DESCRIPTION]   
00598     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_ITECHO filter.<br>
00599     This is effectively a software based echo filter that emulates the DirectX DMO echo effect.  Impulse tracker files can support this, and FMOD will produce the effect on ANY platform, not just those that support DirectX effects!<br>
00600 
00601     [REMARKS]
00602     Note.  Every time the delay is changed, the plugin re-allocates the echo buffer.  This means the echo will dissapear at that time while it refills its new buffer.<br>
00603     Larger echo delays result in larger amounts of memory allocated.<br>
00604     <br>
00605     As this is a stereo filter made mainly for IT playback, it is targeted for stereo signals.<br>
00606     With mono signals only the FMOD_DSP_ITECHO_LEFTDELAY is used.<br>
00607     For multichannel signals (>2) there will be no echo on those channels.<br>
00608 
00609     [PLATFORMS]
00610     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00611 
00612     [SEE_ALSO]      
00613     DSP::SetParameter
00614     DSP::GetParameter
00615     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00616     System::addDSP
00617 ]
00618 */
00619 typedef enum
00620 {
00621     FMOD_DSP_ITECHO_WETDRYMIX,      /* Ratio of wet (processed) signal to dry (unprocessed) signal. Must be in the range from 0.0 through 100.0 (all wet). The default value is 50. */
00622     FMOD_DSP_ITECHO_FEEDBACK,       /* Percentage of output fed back into input, in the range from 0.0 through 100.0. The default value is 50. */
00623     FMOD_DSP_ITECHO_LEFTDELAY,      /* Delay for left channel, in milliseconds, in the range from 1.0 through 2000.0. The default value is 500 ms. */
00624     FMOD_DSP_ITECHO_RIGHTDELAY,     /* Delay for right channel, in milliseconds, in the range from 1.0 through 2000.0. The default value is 500 ms. */
00625     FMOD_DSP_ITECHO_PANDELAY        /* Value that specifies whether to swap left and right delays with each successive echo. The default value is zero, meaning no swap. Possible values are defined as 0.0 (equivalent to FALSE) and 1.0 (equivalent to TRUE).  CURRENTLY NOT SUPPORTED. */
00626 } FMOD_DSP_ITECHO;
00627 
00628 /*
00629 [ENUM]
00630 [  
00631     [DESCRIPTION]   
00632     Parameter types for the FMOD_DSP_TYPE_COMPRESSOR unit.
00633     This is a simple linked multichannel software limiter that is uniform across the whole spectrum.<br>
00634 
00635     [REMARKS]
00636     The limiter is not guaranteed to catch every peak above the threshold level,
00637     because it cannot apply gain reduction instantaneously - the time delay is
00638     determined by the attack time. However setting the attack time too short will
00639     distort the sound, so it is a compromise. High level peaks can be avoided by
00640     using a short attack time - but not too short, and setting the threshold a few
00641     decibels below the critical level.
00642     <br>
00643 
00644     [PLATFORMS]
00645     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00646 
00647     [SEE_ALSO]      
00648     DSP::SetParameter
00649     DSP::GetParameter
00650     FMOD_DSP_TYPE
00651     System::addDSP
00652 ]
00653 */
00654 typedef enum
00655 {
00656     FMOD_DSP_COMPRESSOR_THRESHOLD,  /* Threshold level (dB) in the range from -60 through 0. The default value is 0. */ 
00657     FMOD_DSP_COMPRESSOR_ATTACK,     /* Gain reduction attack time (milliseconds), in the range from 10 through 200. The default value is 50. */
00658     FMOD_DSP_COMPRESSOR_RELEASE,    /* Gain reduction release time (milliseconds), in the range from 20 through 1000. The default value is 50. */
00659     FMOD_DSP_COMPRESSOR_GAINMAKEUP  /* Make-up gain (dB) applied after limiting, in the range from 0 through 30. The default value is 0. */
00660 } FMOD_DSP_COMPRESSOR;
00661

00675     Win32, Win64, Linux, Linux64, Macintosh, Xbox360, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, Wii, iPhone, 3GS, NGP, Android
00676

00679     DSP::GetParameter
00680     FMOD_DSP_TYPE

00682     FMOD_REVERB_PRESETS
00683 ]

00685 typedef enum
00686 {
00687     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_DRYLEVEL,            /* Dry Level      : Mix level of dry signal in output in mB.  Ranges from -10000.0 to 0.0.  Default is 0. */
00688     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_ROOM,                /* Room           : Room effect level at low frequencies in mB.  Ranges from -10000.0 to 0.0.  Default is -10000.0. */
00689     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_ROOMHF,              /* Room HF        : Room effect high-frequency level re. low frequency level in mB.  Ranges from -10000.0 to 0.0.  Default is 0.0. */
00690     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_DECAYTIME,           /* Decay Time     : Reverberation decay time at low-frequencies in seconds.  Ranges from 0.1 to 20.0. Default is 1.0. */
00691     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_DECAYHFRATIO,        /* Decay HF Ratio : High-frequency to low-frequency decay time ratio.  Ranges from 0.1 to 2.0. Default is 0.5. */
00692     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_REFLECTIONSLEVEL,    /* Reflections    : Early reflections level relative to room effect in mB.  Ranges from -10000.0 to 1000.0.  Default is -10000.0. */
00693     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_REFLECTIONSDELAY,    /* Reflect Delay  : Delay time of first reflection in seconds.  Ranges from 0.0 to 0.3.  Default is 0.02. */
00694     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_REVERBLEVEL,         /* Reverb         : Late reverberation level relative to room effect in mB.  Ranges from -10000.0 to 2000.0.  Default is 0.0. */
00695     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_REVERBDELAY,         /* Reverb Delay   : Late reverberation delay time relative to first reflection in seconds.  Ranges from 0.0 to 0.1.  Default is 0.04. */
00696     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_DIFFUSION,           /* Diffusion      : Reverberation diffusion (echo density) in percent.  Ranges from 0.0 to 100.0.  Default is 100.0. */
00697     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_DENSITY,             /* Density        : Reverberation density (modal density) in percent.  Ranges from 0.0 to 100.0.  Default is 100.0. */
00698     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_HFREFERENCE,         /* HF Reference   : Reference high frequency in Hz.  Ranges from 20.0 to 20000.0. Default is 5000.0. */
00699     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_ROOMLF,              /* Room LF        : Room effect low-frequency level in mB.  Ranges from -10000.0 to 0.0.  Default is 0.0. */
00700     FMOD_DSP_SFXREVERB_LFREFERENCE          /* LF Reference   : Reference low-frequency in Hz.  Ranges from 20.0 to 1000.0. Default is 250.0. */
